intro: Tricoryne pterocaulon, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white. Tricoryne pterocaulon is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
